Carries gear on his horse and acknowledges the situation with dynamite and alien remnants, indicating awareness and preparedness.
Admits he has 'messes to clean up' and chooses to ride off rather than stay, which could indicate avoidance or strategic withdrawal.
Engages Ella in a direct and curious manner when confronted about his intentions, showing confidence and emotional control.
Tells Ella that staying would not be good for anybody, showing concern and restraint.
Acknowledges Ella can take care of herself, showing respect and trust.
Initially rejects Happy the dog harshly, telling him to get away.
Turns back to Ella despite trying to stay tough, indicating vulnerability and willingness to connect.
Recognizes potential danger from rumors and strange phenomena, showing awareness and caution.
Plays down his fighting instincts and tries to appear calm and confident.
Tells Ella she can take care of herself, showing confidence in others' abilities and not being overbearing.
Initially rejects his dog Happy's warning and leaves him behind, showing poor judgment in ignoring a potential alert.
Turns back to Ella despite trying to stay tough, indicating internal conflict but also willingness to reconsider decisions.
Reaches out a hand to Ella and helps her up into the saddle, sharing a moment of closeness.
Grumbles 'Stop smiling, Goddammit' despite Ella's obvious happiness.
Pulls Ella up into the saddle confidently and leads the horse away, showing physical capability and confidence.
Kicks the horse to follow the plan, indicating decisiveness and control.
Participates in a coordinated plan involving dynamite to cover evidence, showing strategic thinking and teamwork.
